ratings.comment: Francis was a super sweet guy, but he seemed super confused about what he was teaching and the TA's would correct him a lot of the time. He was also really bad at answering questions. He would send the lecture notes and just read off of them during the class. The TA's taught way more content than Halzen even attempted to cover.

He's a really nice guy but his lectures do NOT help you with anything in your homework or labs or exams. He rambles on and does not go over any of the math problems which make up almost all of the problems on each test. I do not recommend this class unless Pupa is the only one teaching

This class was literally terrible and Francis is a really nice guy but actually doesn't teach you much. He cares more about the concepts rather than the mathematics, which is actually what all the tests are on. Our class had to go through 3-hour review sessions the day before the test with the TA to understand the material. Do not recommend.

Dr. Halzen is a very sweet guy, but his lectures can be kind of confusing. He gets off track easily and doesn't always make stuff super clear. In general, he's an okay professor but I think if he taught a harder class, I would have struggled. The subject material is interesting and he is clearly passionate, just not always very articulate.

Very nice old man but not very helpful. He writes a ton of formulas on the board, and you just copy it all down. I never knew what was going on. He assigns 5 problems from the book a week. Figure out how to do those, and you will be fine. Tests are exactly like the homework and study guide questions. Easy A, without any work.
He is very nice but not the best professor. His lectures are unclear and tests are somewhat hard. Grading scale is predominantly based on 3 exams. I would not recommend him as a professor.
Really awesome professor with a fun accent to listen to. He definitely knows what he's talking about and makes class really interesting with funny remarks. Takes homework right from the book.
'Tis a funny old man who loves what he does.  Also has many witty remarks during class. I strongly recommend this professor.
'Tis a funny old man who loves what he does.  Also has many witty remarks during class. I strongly recommend this professor.
'Tis a funny old man who loves what he does.  Also has many witty remarks during class. I strongly recommend this professor.
He's a funny old man, but messes up his own notes sometimes. However, tests are easy. Read the book, attend most of the lectures then you'll do fine.

He's a cute old man who is fun to listen to.  But unfortunately he doesn't really know what he's talking about, and the class gets confusing, so it's a good thing that the material is pretty easy.  I liked the class and the labs were pretty cool.  its all conceptual stuff, so if you suck at math its ok.
Francis is great. He is very entertaining, but gets confused about the information he is teaching. He is obviously very passionate about teaching, and the class is very easy. Great teacher.

This class used to be taught only with notes and powerpoint, but one of th teachers decided to write a book, so the "easy" class turned hard. They expect you to know more and learn more in less time now and Prof. Halzen does not explain things well at all. He questions himself alot and is corrected by TA's all the time. He's not a very good teacher
Funny old man. Teaches well, very friendly. Class wasn't that hard, either.

Great professor. Easy to understand and very nice personality. Overall, an easy course. Not much use of physics required. However, he is not always in town and someone else takes his place (watch out! if replacement is Morse... not very good).
